selectPoint: Select a point to see its local explanation
_selectPoint.comment: Prompts the user to select a point
_defaultClassNames.comment: models that output classes have this as the default class names
_predictedClass.comment: Norm based on the predicted class rather than absolute value as above
_dataExploration.comment: Label for tab showing scatterplot of dataset and predictions
_globalImportance.comment: Label for tab showing bar chart of importance of features at a global level
_explanationExploration.comment: Label for tab showing scatter plot of dataset and importance of features data
_summmaryImportance.comment: Label showing all importance of feature datapoints in scatter plot
_perturbationExploration.comment: Label for local tab allowing the user to change parameters on a selected point
_localFeatureImportance.comment: Label for local tab showing feature importance of selected point
_intercept.comment: The label for the linear intercept, the bias value

ExplanationScatter._dataLabel.comment: prepend in front of column names
ExplanationScatter._importanceLabel.comment: prepend in front of feature importance of column name
ExplanationScatter._index.comment: the index value (an integer of the row number)
ExplanationScatter._probabilityLabel.comment: Probability prefix for all classes in a multiclass problem
ExplanationScatter._trueY.comment: The true value to be predicted

CrossClass.label: Cross-class weighting:
CrossClass._label.comment: label for dropdown allowing user to select how importance across multiple output classes is aggregated
CrossClass.overviewInfo: Multiclass models generate an independent feature importance vector for each class. Each class's feature importance vector demonstrates which features made a class more likely or less likely. You can select how the weights of the per-class feature importance vectors are summarized into a single value:
CrossClass.absoluteValInfo: Average of absolute value: Shows the sum of the feature's importance across all possible classes, divided by number of classes
CrossClass.predictedClassInfo: Predicted class: Shows the feature importance value for a given point's predicted class
CrossClass.enumeratedClassInfo: Enumerated class names: Shows only the specified class's feature importance values across all data points.
CrossClass._enumeratedClassInfo.comment: explains the weights for selecting a single class

AggregateImportance._scaledFeatureValue.comment: The chart shows all data in a color scale (normalized to 0 - 1). This is the label for the color bar
AggregateImportance._low.comment: The low end of the color bar
AggregateImportance._high.comment: label for the high end of the color bar
AggregateImportance._predictedClassTooltip.comment: prefixed in front of the output class names predicted by the model
AggregateImportance._trueClassTooltip.comment: prefixed in front of the true class labels
AggregateImportance._predictedOutputTooltip.comment: prefixed in front of the output in a regression model (numeric, no classes)
AggregateImportance._trueOutputTooltip.comment: prefixed in front of the true value in a regression model (numeric, no classes)
AggregateImportance._topKFeatures.comment: Label for slider to show only the top (k) most important features, where the slider is used to set the value of k
AggregateImportance._predictedValue.comment: Label for dropdown option, group data by the predicted value from the model (numeric values)
AggregateImportance._predictedClass.comment: Label for dropdown option, group data by predicted class from model
AggregateImportance._trueValue.comment: label for dropdown option, group data by true value (numeric)
AggregateImportance._trueClass.comment: label for dropdown, group data by true class
AggregateImportance._noColor.comment: label for dropdown, do not apply any grouping
AggregateImportance.tooManyRows: The provided dataset is larger than this chart can support
AggregateImportance._tooManyRows.comment: error message if the dataset is too large to visualize

BarChart._sortBy.comment: prompt for setting how values are sorted
BarChart._noData.comment: Error message for no applicable data
BarChart._absoluteGlobal.comment: sorting option, sort by the absolute value of the importance of all datapoints
BarChart._absoluteLocal.comment: sorting option, sort by the absolute value of the importance for the single selected point

IcePlot._numericError.comment: error message if non-numeric characters typed
IcePlot._integerError.comment: error message if non-integer values typed by user
IcePlot.noModelError: Please provide an operationalized model to explore predictions in ICE plots.
IcePlot._noModelError.comment: error message for no model present
IcePlot._stepInputLabel.comment: number of samples to include between minimum and maximum (integer)
IcePlot.submitPrompt: Submit a range to view an ICE plot
IcePlot._submitPrompt.comment: prompt to user giving instructions to enter a numeric range
IcePlot._topLevelErrorMessage.comment: error message for any parameter issue
IcePlot._errorPrefix.comment: prefix in front of external error

PerturbationExploration._perturbationLabel.comment: Perturbation (ie. the user has made a set of small changes to the original data -- a perturbation. This is the label for the resulting prediction)

PredictionLabel._predictionValueLabel.comment: label for prediction of numeric values
PredictionLabel._predictedClassLabel.comment: label for prediction of class value

Violin._groupPredicted.comment: option to group data by predicted class
Violin._groupTrue.comment: option to group data by true class
Violin._groupBy.comment: Group by prompt for dropdown to select how data should be grouped

FeatureImportanceWrapper._chartType.comment: label for dropdown to select chart format
FeatureImportanceWrapper._beehiveText.comment: A swarm plot (its like a scatter plot with categorical x axis with dithering, see examples https://seaborn.pydata.org/generated/seaborn.swarmplot.html)
FeatureImportanceWrapper.globalImportanceExplanation: Global feature importance is calculated by averaging the absolute value of the feature importance of all points (L1 normalization).
FeatureImportanceWrapper._globalImportanceExplanation.comment: explains how global feature importance is calculated
FeatureImportanceWrapper.multiclassImportanceAddendum: All points are included in calculating a feature's importance for all classes, no differential weighting is used. So a feature that has large negative importance for many points predicted to not be of 'Class A' will greatly increase that feature's 'Class A'  importance.
FeatureImportanceWrapper._multiclassImportanceAddendum.comment: explains how global importance is calculated for each class in a multiclass case.
